h5502.definition: a primitive root; to scrape off; sweep (away).

h5503.definition: a primitive root; to travel round (specifically as a pedlar); intensively, to palpitate; go about, merchant(-man), occupy with, pant, trade, traffick.

h5505.definition: from {{h5503}}; an emporium; abstractly, profit (from trade); mart, merchandise.

h5507.definition: properly, active participle feminine of {{h5503}}; something surrounding the person, i.e. a shield; buckler.

h5508.definition: similar to {{h5507}}; probably a (black) tile (or tessara) for laying borders with; black marble.

h5509.definition: or סוּג; (Ezekiel 22:18), from {{h5472}} in the sense of refuse; scoria; dross.

h5510.definition: probably of Persian origin; Sivan, the third Hebrew month; Sivan.

h5511.definition: or סִיחֹן; from the same as {{h5477}}; tempestuous; Sichon, an Amoritish king; Sihon.

h5512.definition: of uncertain derivation; Sin the name of an Egyptian town and (probably) desert adjoining; Sin.

h5513.definition: from an otherwise unknown name of a man; a Sinite, or descendant of one of the sons of Canaan; Sinite.

h5514.definition: of uncertain derivation; Sinai, mountain of Arabia; Sinai.

h5515.definition: plural of an otherwise unknown name; Sinim, a distant Oriental region; Sinim.

h5516.definition: of uncertain derivation; Sisera, the name of a Canaanitish king and of one of the Nethinim; Sisera.

h5517.definition: or סִיעֲהָא; from an unused root meaning to converse; congregation; Sia or Siaha, one of the Nethinim; Sia, Siaha.

h5518.definition: or (feminine) סִירָה; or סִרָה; (Jeremiah 52:18), from a primitive root meaning to boil up; a pot; also a thorn (as springing up rapidly); by implication, a hook; caldron, fishhook, pan, (wash-)pot, thorn.

h5519.definition: from {{h5526}}; properly, a thicket of men, i.e. a crowd; multitude.

h5520.definition: from {{h5526}}; a hut (as of entwined boughs); also a lair; covert, den, pavilion, tabernacle.

h5521.definition: feminine of {{h5520}}; a hut or lair; booth, cottage, covert, pavilion, tabernacle, tent.

h5523.definition: or סֻכֹּת; plural of {{h5521}}; booths; Succoth, the name of a place in Egypt and of three in Palestine; Succoth.

h5524.definition: from {{h5523}} and the (irregular) plural of {{h1323}}; booths of (the) daughters; brothels, i.e. idoalatrous tents for impure purpose; Succothbenoth.

h5525.definition: patrial from an unknown name (perhaps {{h5520}}); a Sukkite, or inhabitant of some place near Egypt (i.e. hut-dwellers); Sukkiims.

h5526.definition: or שָׂכַךְ; (Exodus 33:22), a primitive root; properly, to entwine as a screen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect; cover, defence, defend, hedge in, join together, set, shut up.

h5527.definition: from {{h5526}}; inclosure; Secacah, a place in Palestine; Secacah.

h5528.definition: for {{h3688}}; to be silly; do (make, play the, turn into) fool(-ish, -ishly, -ishness).

h5529.definition: from {{h5528}}; silliness; concretely and collectively, dolts; folly.

h5531.definition: or שִׂכְלוּת; (Ecclesiastes 1:17), from {{h5528}}; silliness; folly, foolishness.

h5532.definition: a primitive root; to be familiar with; by implication, to minister to, be serviceable to, to cherish, be customary; acquaint (self), be advantage, × ever, (be, (un-)) profit(-able), treasurer, be wont.

h5533.definition: probably a denominative from {{h7915}}; properly, to cut, i.e. damage; also to grow (causatively, make) poor; endanger, impoverish.

h5534.definition: a primitive root; to shut up; by implication, to surrender; stop, give over. See also {{h5462}}, {{h7936}}.

h5535.definition: a primitive root to be silent; by implication, to observe quietly; take heed.

h5536.definition: from {{h5549}}; properly, a willow twig (as pendulous), i.e. an osier; but only as woven into a basket; basket.

h5537.definition: a primitive root; to suspend in a balance, i.e. weigh; compare.

h5538.definition: from {{h5549}}; an embankment; Silla, a place in Jerusalem; Silla.

h5539.definition: a primitive root; probably to leap (with joy), i.e. exult; harden self.

h5540.definition: from {{h5539}}; exultation; Seled, an Israelite; Seled.

h5541.definition: a primitive root; to hang up, i.e. weigh, or (figuratively) contemn; tread down (under foot), value.

h5542.definition: from {{h5541}}; suspension (of music), i.e. pause; Selah.

h5543.definition: or סַלּוּא; or סָלוּא; or סַלַּי; from {{h5541}}; weighed; Sallu or Sallai, the name of two Israelites; Sallai, Sallu, Salu.

h5544.definition: or סַלּוֹן; from {{h5541}}; a prickle (as if pendulous); brier, thorn.

h5545.definition: a primitive root; to forgive; forgive, pardon, spare.

h5548.definition: from an unused root. meaning to walk; walking; Salcah, a place East of the Jordan; Salcah, Salchah.

h5549.definition: a primitive root; to mound up (especially a turnpike); figurative, to exalt; reflexively, to oppose (as by a dam); cast up, exalt (self), extol, make plain, raise up.

h5550.definition: or סוֹלְלָה; active participle feminine of {{h5549}}, but used passively; a military mound, i.e. rampart of besiegers; bank, mount.

h5553.definition: from an unused root meaning to be lofty; a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress); (ragged) rock, stone(-ny), strong hold.

h5554.definition: the same as {{h5553}}; Sela, the rock-city of Idumaea; rock, Sela(-h).

h5555.definition: from {{h5553}} and the plural of {{h4256}} with the article interposed; rock of the divisions; Sela-ham-Machlekoth, a place in Palestine; Sela-hammalekoth.

h5556.definition: apparently from the same as {{h5553}} in the sense of crushing as with a rock, i.e. consuming; a kind of locust (from its destructiveness); bald locust.

h5557.definition: a primitive root; properly, to wrench, i.e. (figuratively) to subvert; overthrow, pervert.

h5559.definition: (Aramaic) a primitive root; to ascend; come (up).

h5560.definition: from an unused root meaning to strip; flour (as chipped off); (fine) flour, meal.

h5561.definition: from an unused root meaning to smell sweet; an aroma; sweet (spice).

h5562.definition: of foreign origin; Samgar-Nebo, a Babylonian general; Samgar-nebo.

h5563.definition: of uncertain derivation; a vine blossom; used also adverbially, abloom; tender grape.

h5564.definition: a primitive root; to prop (literally or figuratively); reflexively, to lean upon or take hold of (in a favorable or unfavorable sense); bear up, establish, (up-) hold, lay, lean, lie hard, put, rest self, set self, stand fast, stay (self), sustain.

h5565.definition: from {{h5564}} and {{h3050}}; supported of Jah; Semakjah, an Israelite; Semachiah.

h5566.definition: or סֵמֶל; from an unused root meaning to resemble; a likeness; figure, idol, image.

h5567.definition: a primitive root; to designate; appointed.

h5568.definition: a primitive root; to be erect, i.e. bristle as hair; stand up, tremble.

h5570.definition: from an unused root meaning to prick; thorny; Senaah, a place in Palestine; Senaah, Hassenaah (with the article).

h5571.definition: of foreign origin; Sanballat, a Persian satrap of Samaria; Sanballat.

h5572.definition: from an unused root meaning to prick; a bramble; bush.

h5573.definition: the same as {{h5572}}; thorn; Seneh, a crag in Palestine; Seneh.

h5574.definition: or סְנֻאָה from the same as {{h5570}}; pointed; (used with the article as a proper name) Senuah, the name of two Israelites; Hasenuah (including the art), Senuah.

h5575.definition: of uncertain derivation; (in plural) blindness; blindness.

h5576.definition: of foreign origin; Sancherib, an Assyrian king; Sennacherib.

h5577.definition: from an unused root meaning to be pointed; a twig (as tapering); bough.

h5578.definition: feminine of a form of {{h5577}}; a bough; Sansannah, a place in Palestine; Sansannah.

h5579.definition: of uncertain derivation; a fin (collectively); fins.

h5580.definition: from the same as {{h5483}}; a moth (from the agility of the fly); moth.

h5581.definition: of uncertain derivation; Sismai, an Israelite; Sisamai.

h5582.definition: a primitive root; to support (mostly figurative); comfort, establish, hold up, refresh self, strengthen, be upholden.

h5584.definition: a primitive root; to rush; storm.

h5585.definition: from {{h5586}}; a fissure (of rocks); also a bough (as subdivided); (outmost) branch, clift, top.

h5586.definition: a primitive root; properly, to divide up; but used only as denominative from {{h5585}},; to disbranch (a tree); top.

h5587.definition: or שָׂעִף; from {{h5586}}; divided (in mind), i.e. (abstractly) a sentiment; opinion.

h5588.definition: from {{h5586}}; divided (in mind), i.e. (concretely) a skeptic; thought.

h5589.definition: feminine of {{h5585}}; a twig or branch; bough. Compare {{h5634}}.

h5590.definition: a primitive root; to rush upon; by implication, to toss (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); be (toss with) tempest(-uous), be sore, troubled, come out as a (drive with the, scatter with a) whirlwind.

h5591.definition: or (feminine) סְעָרָה; from {{h5590}}; a hurricane; storm(-y), tempest, whirlwind.

h5592.definition: from {{h5605}}, in its original sense of containing; a vestibule (as a limit); also a dish (for holding blood or wine); bason, bowl, cup, door (post), gate, post, threshold.

h5593.definition: the same as {{h5592}}; Saph, a Philistine; Saph. Compare {{h5598}}.

h5594.definition: a primitive root; properly, to tear the hair and beat the breasts (as Orientals do in grief); generally to lament; by implication, to wail; lament, mourn(-er), wail.

h5595.definition: a primitive root; properly, to scrape (literally, to shave; but usually figuratively) together (i.e. to accumulate or increase) or away (i.e. to scatter, remove, or ruin; intransitively, to perish); add, augment, consume, destroy, heap, join, perish, put.

h5596.definition: or שָׂפַח; (Isaiah 3:17), a primitive root; properly, to scrape out, but in certain peculiar senses (of removal or association); abiding, gather together, cleave, smite with the scab.

h5597.definition: from {{h5596}}; the mange (as making the hair fall off); scab.

h5598.definition: from {{h5592}}; bason-like; Sippai, a Philistine; Sippai. Compare {{h5593}}.

h5599.definition: from {{h5596}}; something (spontaneously) falling off, i.e. a self-sown crop; figuratively, a freshet; (such) things as (which) grow (of themselves), which groweth of its own accord (itself).

h5600.definition: from {{h5603}}; a (sea-going) vessel (as ceiled with a deck); ship.
